list_definition.definition: a hole or vault in the ground in which a dead body is put; a grave

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was buried in the family tomb.

list_ex_of_english: Indeed, the tomb complexes were originally built as burial places for the family members of high officials.
However, the numerous shafts and chambers of the tomb complexes were extensively used for later burials.
Some years ago a farmer working his field stumbled on the entrance of a shaft tomb.
The eldest son will take in both good things and bad - everything including the family tomb.
He then managed to recover the offerings from this tomb intact.
The shaft tomb discovered in the structure at the southern end of the plaza could strengthen this hypothesis.
Many contributors link the use of shaft tombs to lineages or similar social groups.
These tombs seem to represent different possibilities of interment for different lineages in a rank society.
